> <OLD>
>
> Tucson floors his gas pedal and pushes on at a rapid speed, eve=
n more so than he was used to. He was determined to get through the crisis =
and find Rodimus. His heart had shown him the way, and there was nothing an=
yone could do to stop him. With Vestige in his cab, he keeps careful watch =
over his newly found old friend, and secures him with a saftey belt around =
his shoulders, to keep him safely in place on his seat.
>
> "Hold on Vestig=
e, the ride may get rough, but we will make it."

Vestige makes no movement=
, but with Tuscon's help he is securely held
in the seat of Tuscon's cab.

=
With a burst of power from Tuscon the powerful vehicle rushed foward,
pushi=
ng through the rest of the hall and powering through the frame of
the doorw=
ay. As Tuscon came into the room he was immediately ensnared
in what would =
appear to be vines or perhaps more of those Tendrils
similar to the ones th=
at had bound Rodimus before all this started.
They attempted to snake thier=
 way around his vehicular mode to hold
him in place.

The walls and floor o=
f this room were white, sterile and clean. The
floor was crafted from some =
sort of metal as were the walls. In the
middle of the room a single bed sur=
rounded by all sorts of scanning
and medical equipment. Three insect creatu=
res were standing over the
bed. They were obviously of the same race as the=
 spider like creatures
and the winged ones that had been harrassing Tuscon =
before, but these
were in a more humanoid mode, a 'robot' mode if you will.=
 All three of
them were female, at least they would appear to be if a human=
 were
looking on. On the bed a figure lay strapped down, the form blocked
f=
rom view by the figures that stood over it.

"You are too late Autobot!" On=
e of the three females said, the taller
of the two in the center. "We have =
all that we need from this one, and
even now your data will fill our banks =
with data, data that we can use
to bring about your destruction."

The tend=
rils that were struggling to hold on to Tuscon were begining
to change not =
only color to match Tuscon, but also thier texture and
shape were modifying=
 as well.

The larger female stepped away from the bed to walk towards Tusc=
on,
"The queen will want you for herself." The female smiled, "We shall
see=
 that you are prepared for her."

As the female approached it was possible =
to see the figure on the bed,
it looked like Hot Rod!

(TAG)

Preston
